msItem.author: Honorius Augustodunensis
msItem.title: Commentary on the Song of Songs
msItem.rubric: (fol. 1) Incipit cantica canticorum ab Onorio enucleasius exposita. Incipit sigillum sancte Marie
msItem.incipit: Donum sapientie cum Salomone poscenti a vero pacifico postulatum [corrected in a contemporary hand from postulata] datur [written over erasure]. Quia precedessori [sic, apparently corrected from predecessori] tuo beate memorie venerando C. abbati librum David
msItem.note: This is the dedicatory preface to the Expositio and not the Sigillum
msItem.incipit: (fol. 1) [first prologue (no heading)] In principio librorum tria requiruntur
Auctor huius libri est spiritus sanctus
(fol. 7) [second prologue (no heading)] Imperator supernus publice cupiens
(fol. 12) 'Accessus ad litteram' Filius regis Ierusalem desponsavit
(fol. 13v) 'Incipit liber'. Osculetur me osculo oris sui Ac si dicat internuntiis. Qui tociens.
msItem.note: This is not the usual beginning of Bk. I, which is found on fol. 12, but the beginning of the Commentary itself. The next rubric, Osculetur me, given by Stegmüller, is omitted, the text continuing (Sacra scriptura) without a break. Bk. II beg. fol. 57; Bk. III, fol. 121; Bk. IV, fol. 144.
msItem.explicit: (fol. 170v) Lapsum deduxit ante conspectum Dei. Amen.
msItem.incipit:
(fol. 170v)
Ut labor noster omnibus fructuosus brevi epilogo omnia repetamus
msItem.note: The rest of fol. 172v was later filled with theological (?) notes, now erased.

supportDesc.collation: 1(8)-14(8), 15(8) (7 canc.), 16(8)–22(8), 23(4) (4 canc.), quires numbered at the end in roman numerals (one missed after XVII), short horizontal catchwords
supportDesc.condition: The MS. has at some time been damaged by damp or water.

layoutDesc.layout: 2 cols., 22-4 lines, ruled with a hard point up to fol. 145 and the rest ruled in pencil. Written space 135-40 100

handDesc.handNote: Firm rounded minuscule, writing above top line

decoDesc.summary: Pächt and Alexander ii. 66, pl. VI
decoDesc.decoNote: Pen drawings: fol. 1r, King Solomon; fol. 13v, Christ preaching (?); fol. 121v, head of Christ, and a monster; fol. 144r, a bishop, in the border are a monster and a bird. On fols. 56v-57r similar drawings have been coloured, chiefly in deep blue, with pale blue, orange, green, and violet: fol. 56v, miniature of King Solomon on his throne.

binding.p: Modern darkbrown morocco binding by Sangorski and Sutcliffe.

history.provenance: At the top of fol. 172 is an erased 13th cent. ex-libris: 'Ista cantica est monasterii S[?. . .] F[? . . . . .] de Parm [? . . .]' and above this a later (14th-cent.?) hand has written 'S. Sita' (?).
A later erased note on fol. 1 (17th-18th cent.) apparently described the contents of the MS.
James P. R. Lyell, 1871–1948: bought n February 1942 from E. P. Goldschmidt and Co.: see his Cat. 44, no. II.
history.acquisition: Chosen as one of the hundred manuscripts bequeathed to the Bodleian by Lyell in 1948.

recordHist.source: A. C. de la Mare, Catalogue of the Medieval Manuscripts Bequeathed to the Bodleian Library Oxford by James P. R. Lyell (1971) Catalogue, p. 207 Catalogue, p. 208

revisionDesc.change: Add all information from printed catalogue.

Mitch Fraas Provenance and acquisition information added using https://github.com/littlegustv/oxfordupdates/blob/master/test_case_for_oxford_prov.rb in collaboration with the Mapping Manuscript Migrations project.
James Cummings Up-converted the markup using https://github.com/jamescummings/Bodleian-msDesc-ODD/blob/master/convertTolkien2Bodley.xsl
